ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.sensor

Class ColorDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.sensor.ColorDetector

  • public class ColorDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses the robot's front light sensor to determine the color of a given object. The color detection algorithm is limited to a subset of colors that correspond to the rings provided for the ring collection task.

    The ColorDetector class uses the following encoding for colors:

    • 1 = Blue
    • 2 = Green
    • 3 = Yellow
    • 4 = Orange
    • 5 = None

    In addition to simple color classification, the ColorDetection class provides a set of methods for particular modes of operation. Some of these methods are color detection demo mode and raw red value printing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorDetector(TextLCD lcd, LightPoller lightPoller)
      Creates a color detector that can display its results into the LCD display of the robot.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void demoDetection()
      Runs color detection indefinitely.
      int getColor()
      Uses the light sensor to detect the color of an object placed in front of the central light sensor.
      void printRed()
      Prints the red value readings from the left and right light sensors into the console on an infinite loop.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorDetector

        public ColorDetector(TextLCD lcd,
                     LightPoller lightPoller)
        Creates a color detector that can display its results into the LCD display of the robot.
        Parameters:
        lcd - TextLCD representing the display of the robot.
        lightPoller - LightPoller object containing the light sensors of the robot.
        See Also:
        LightPoller, TextLCD

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Uses the light sensor to detect the color of an object placed in front of the central light sensor.
        Returns:
        A number in the range [1, 5] representing the color detected.

      • demoDetection

        public void demoDetection()
        Runs color detection indefinitely. The result of the detection is displayed on the robot's LCD, if no color is detected the screen is set to blank.

      • printRed

        public void printRed()
        Prints the red value readings from the left and right light sensors into the console on an infinite loop. This method is useful for tuning of the line detection algorithm.
